summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons Program Statement (P3420.11) titled 'Standards of Employee Conduct', approved by Director Charles E. Samuels, Jr. It establishes comprehensive ethical and conduct policies for all BOP employees, contractors, and volunteers, covering areas such as conflicts of interest, outside employment, personal conduct (including strict prohibitions on relationships with inmates), and disciplinary procedures. It is a general policy document, not a case-specific record related to Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Charles E. Samuels, Jr.
persons.context: Approved the Program Statement 'Standards of Employee Conduct' as the Director of the Federal Bureau of Prisons.

keyFacts: The document is the BOP's official 'Standards of Employee Conduct' policy (Program Statement P3420.11), dated December 6, 2013.

It explicitly and strictly prohibits any sexual or inappropriate relationships, contact, or favoritism between staff and inmates, stating 'There is never any such thing as consensual sex between staff and inmates.'
The policy mandates that employees immediately report any violations of conduct standards to their CEO or other appropriate authority, such as the Office of the Inspector General.

It includes detailed disciplinary guidelines (Attachment A) outlining offenses and penalty ranges, with severe penalties including removal for offenses like improper relationships with inmates or failure to report violations.
The policy applies broadly to all BOP employees, Public Health Service employees, National Institute of Corrections employees, and contractors and volunteers working in BOP facilities.
